Idea: slightly more advanced blog design preview tools.

I’d like it if I could set the blog to “dummy blog” that would have posts with placeholder content and enough posts to be multiple pages deep.

This would help with testing features of blogs like pagination on brand new sites, which don’t yet have blog posts.

Right now the current process is really slow (create like 15 dummy posts to test, then delete them)
for forms: Allow us to send a "thank you email" to the person filling out the form rather than having to create a separate workflow to send it. Similar to how Wufoo does it

would it make sense to build an easy to access button in form widgets for creating this via workflows?

Or an interface that creates a workflow like this in the background essentially but gives a simpler interface in the widget?
I only ask because I don’t think workflows itself is the problem but the easy of building/managing confirmation emails is
interface that lets you create the email and all from the form widget interface would be easiest i think
Can we have a zoom in and out feature in the design manager code writing area? Or the ability to set the size of the type?
